snippet: A United Nations panel urges the seizure of oil trucks entering and leaving territory controlled by jihadists in Iraq and Syria and a moratorium on antiquities sales from those countries.
abstract: United Nations panel urges Security Council to order all countries to seize oil trucks coming in and out of territory controlled by jihadists in Iraq and Syria and to impose global moratorium on sale of antiquities from those countries; both oil and antiquities are thought to be vital sources of financing for groups that call themselves the Islamic State and the Nusra Front.
lead_paragraph: A United Nations panel urges the seizure of oil trucks entering and leaving territory controlled by jihadists in Iraq and Syria and a moratorium on antiquities sales from those countries.

headline.main: Push in U.N. to Intercept Jihadists’ Oil
headline.print_headline: Push in U.N. to Intercept Jihadists’ Oil

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
